channel.title: Online players does not update
channel.description:
Ok, on my quest tab i have it coded to show online players, but it does not update when players sign in or out, it just stays the same..
here is what i got [code]c.sendQuest("@or1@Players Online: @whi@" + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+ "", 7337);[/code]

item.title: Online players does not update
item.dc:creator: @droidmobile droidmobile@yahoo.com
item.description:
@droidmobile wrote:

K i will try that, but also another thing, is there a timer i could add to it up make it update every 0 seconds?

Like annoTimer?

It worked, thanks bro. cheers

Read full topic

item.title: Online players does not update
item.dc:creator: @rova1 rova1
item.description:
@rova1 wrote:

I’m sorry that’s what I meant, texthandler… forgot about delta there for a sec

anyway still try what I said and I’m almost certain it will work. It won’t move from the quest tab at all, it will just update immediately

item.title: Online players does not update
item.dc:creator: @Evocation Evocation
item.description:
@Evocation wrote:

[quote=“droidmobile@yahoo.com, post:8, topic:376365”]It’s not in clickingmost.java

I got it under texthandler.java to appear in my questtab.

If i remove, it will dissapear from my questtab, and i dont want that. I just want it up update when a player signs in or out, showing the correct amount of players online.[/quote] p.sendQuest("@whi@ Players Online: " + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount() + , 174);??

item.title: Online players does not update
item.dc:creator: @rova1 rova1
item.description:
@rova1 wrote:

You have this:

c.sendQuest("@or1@Players Online: @whi@" + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+ "", 7337);

I’m assuming it’s in clickingMost.java

Try deleting it from there.

Now make a modified version, like so:

sendQuest("@or1@Players Online: @whi@" + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+ "", 7337);

Right, now place this modified version in client.java under this bit:

public boolean process() {

Hopefully it should work.

Read full topic
